Posts.Content: Just posted this in new members...thought it might be more appropriate in here. Cool Wish I knew now what I didn't know then. Hello fellow students of the prostate. Well at least for me, since February I have been reading so much regarding the prostate, and cancer of. I have enjoyed my few hours here reading your posts. I came here one time before this all sunk in, but didn't get the depth of understanding you have at that point. I was like...what does all that 3+3, % biopsies stuff they are talking bout. Well now I have a better understanding. I went from wow, I have cancer, to let me find out about this stuff, to how can I fight it...all in a few short months. I had a psa of 4.5, 2xs over 6 months, and was referred to a urol, who immediately did the dre, which told him I needed a biopsy which told him I need surgery. He suggested davinci since he was skilled in that technique. I was ambivalent at first, but that turned to concern. He suggested I should wait no more than a month. Fortunately, I am at least 50 pounds overweight, and he mentioned that this would work against my recovery but not an issue. I found my out!! If I lose weight, I increase my odds or successful surgery, recovery and less side effects. Sign me up. It bought me a month. That is when I started reading. Dr. Walsh, Dr. Clapp, online resources, forums like this. Anything I could get my hands on. This led me to a second opinion, which lab results found the same, Gleason 3+3, but the dre was normal, and I got my psa down to 4. How encouraging, except the surgeon recommended at my age 56, cut it out, by either means, open or davinci. Back to the weight...more time, I have lost 40 and have kept it off since june, but an shooting for another 20-30 which would put me at the 200lbs mark at 5'10". I am ok with that. I go in this Friday for another psa test, the proof is in the pudding. I have decided no surgery while psa is low and I am losing weight. Changed diet, increased exercise, and feeling pretty good. And after a week vacation in the carribean last month, Iam not even worrying so much anymore. Thatn is my story. Thanks for reading to the end.
Posts.Title: Wish I knew then..

Posts.Content: Newporter: Not sure what the acronyms are but will look them up and figure it out. I am not sure it is worth the gamble. But by that I mean, the gamble to take, or not take action. Either way it feels like a gamble. At least I feel like I am having a say in this. I went from in a couple weeks to almost a year later. I feel better, unless of course it has been running rampant and I am doomed. Guess I will find out next week. At this point cost hasn't been an issue, it may at some point, but not now. Again, not sure if it is courage or fear!! Maybe a fine line!
Posts.Title: Wish I knew then..

Posts.Title: Wish I knew then..

Posts.Content: JohnT: Thanks for the info. I have been focusing on the weight loss, and somewhat avoiding the watching, although fully aware of the implications, or at least some of them. I would have to look at the lab results again but I believe I had on over 50%. Not sure what the density is about. Still so much to learn. Thanks for the reading suggestions, I will get on that.
Posts.Title: Wish I knew then..

Posts.Content: Wow!! Thank you for all the responses. I thought this would be a good place to throw out some thoughts, but I can see I need to really read these great replies carefully. I see plenty of things here I need to understand better, so I can continue to make "informed" decisions. Thanks to you all. I will respond as I fully understand what each of you are saying. Again, thanks.
